revised_title: Mesonically Decaying Hypernuclei: A Systematic Study
tldr: This article reports a systematic study of 260,000 stars, producing 40 mesonically decaying hyperfragments. The authors identify and calculate the binding energies of these hyperfragments, providing insights into the properties of hypernuclei and their decay modes. The study contributes to the understanding of hypernuclear interactions and the behavior of hyperons in the nucleus.
